channel.title: My upgraded template... (Still probably sucks)
channel.description:
So I took some suggestions... Then raged and started over... This is what i have so far...
[IMG]http://i1062.photobucket.com/albums/t499/202685/lkjhgf.png[/img]
Things I added...
[ul][li]Rounded Edges[/li] [li]Drop-Down Menu[/li] [li]Headers And Footers That Extend Through The Whole Screen[/li] [li]More Colors Than Just #333, #666, and #999[/li][/ul]
So can you give me some feedback about it (Good or bad I don't care) Here's a download so you can see how it works... (I didn't feel like adding a logo)
[url=http://db.tt/NfT3vxbP]http://db.tt/NfT3vxbP[/url] (Short Dropbox Link)
So leave some feedback, Thanks

item.title: My upgraded template... (Still probably sucks)
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

Hmmm… no complaints so far, so I’m going to just say what others have said, “add more content then update”.

Read full topic

item.title: My upgraded template... (Still probably sucks)
item.description:
@202685 wrote:

[quote=“RevengePK, post:6, topic:444805”][code]

Sweet New Sticky Footer Across Whole Screen (Thanks Kryptix)
[/code]

Your HTML is kind of crazy in this one, try too look up a bit about formatting & structure.

Basic HTML page format with the minimal needed doctype should look like:

[code]

[/code][/quote]

well i had to make a sticky footer and i needed those divs to do it

Read full topic

item.title: My upgraded template... (Still probably sucks)

item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

color! No one likes a bland website. A nice vibrant green would flow greatly with that gray.

item.title: My upgraded template... (Still probably sucks)
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

</ul>
</head>
<div id="wrap">

<div id="main">
<div id="header">
</div>

</div>

<body>

</body>
</div>
<div id="footer">Sweet New Sticky Footer Across Whole Screen (Thanks Kryptix)</div>
</html>

Your HTML is kind of crazy in this one, try too look up a bit about formatting & structure.

Basic HTML page format with the minimal needed doctype should look like:

<!DOCTYPE html>
<head>
<title></title>
</head>
<body>

</body>
</html>

Read full topic

The above three comments.

and, include a sample image as a logo to give a feel for the page and where the nav bar would realistically sit.

So I took some suggestions… Then raged and started over… This is what i have so far…
